title: Long Blades
data:
***Version [0.31](/0.31 "0.31")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

The [Long Blades]() skill that governs your proficiency with [long swords](/Long_sword "Long sword") and other such blades. These weapons deal moderate-to-high damage, depending on whether you wish to wield one- or two-handed swords. It [crosstrains](/Crosstrain "Crosstrain") with the [Short Blades](/Short_Blades "Short Blades") skill.

Long Blades use [dexterity](/Dexterity "Dexterity") instead of [strength](/Strength "Strength") for their attacks.

- [2 List of Long Blades](#List_of_Long_Blades)

## Strategy

Since Long Blades scale with dexterity, they are relatively better on [Dodging](/Dodging "Dodging")-focused characters. DEX increases the evasion you gain from Dodging skill, which lends well to lighter armour.

However, this is not an especially forcing reason to use Long Blades. A heavy armour character can use Long Blades just fine, while lightly armoured characters don't *have* to use one. Early on, if you find a great [randart](/Randart "Randart") blade, don't hesitate to train Long Blades - "DEX character" or not.

## History

- In [0.29](/0.29 "0.29"), long blades now scale with [dexterity](/Dexterity "Dexterity"), instead of [strength](/Strength "Strength").
- In [0.28](/0.28 "0.28"), long blades lost the ability to [riposte](/Riposte "Riposte"). Base damage was returned to pre-[0.19](/0.19 "0.19") levels.
- In [0.19](/0.19 "0.19"), long blades gained the ability to [riposte](/Riposte "Riposte") (counter-attack enemies that missed), with damage slightly decreased to compensate.
- In [0.16](/0.16 "0.16"), [bastard swords](/Bastard_sword "Bastard sword") and [claymores](/Claymore "Claymore") were renamed back to double and triple swords. [Blessed weapons](/Blessed_weapon "Blessed weapon") were removed.
- In [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), double and triple swords were renamed to bastard swords and claymores, respectively.
